intro: Anisolobus hostmannii, commonly known as the Hostmann's anisolobus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. It produces small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
